intro: Landukia landuk, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tansy, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and historical use in herbal medicine highlight its ecological and cultural significance.
